funfact: The first computer virus was created in 1983 and was called the Elk Cloner. It was created by a 15-year-old high school student named Rich Skrenta.
The first computer bug was an actual bug. In 1947, a moth was found in the Harvard Mark II computer, causing a malfunction. The term 'bug' has been used ever since to describe a computer error.
The first computer mouse was invented by Douglas Engelbart in 1964. It was made of wood and had two wheels.
The first computer was invented in 1943 by the British. It was called the Colossus and was used to break German codes during World War II.

There is a scam that is right by the equator of the world. Believing that the northern half the water will swirl clockwise and the southern half will swirl counterclockwise, the scam is that the water will swirl counterclockwise. However this is mainly noticable at the poles and gets weaker the closer you get to the equator. The scam works by subtle motion of the hand as the water is leaving the bucket.

Why don't modern people put a fan to blow a sail to go a direction? Well the problem with this logic is while the sail will be pushed to go forward the amount of pressure the pan is putting out is going the exact oppsoite direction. Thus nothing gets moved. Except for my ego since nothing is pushing against it.

When the empire strikes back was being filmed, the actors were not told that Darth Vader was Luke's father. The actors were given a script ahead of time and everyone had learned it however Hershner had pulled the actors aside for a script change 15 minutes before the shot.

For the dream works movie How to train your dragon, Toothless was modeled after one of the animators cat. In one of the scenes where Hiccup attaches the prosthetic wing onto toothless tail, To get inspiration on how Toothless should act an animator attaches tape to his cat and modeled the animation after that.

The famous line "A delayed game is eventually good, but a rushed game is forever bad." was claimed to have been said by Shigeru Miyamoto. However there is no evidence of him actually saying this qoute.

Despite many people thinking that the teleconferencing call company Zoom came out in response to the world wide pandemic in March 2020, Zoom was actually released in 2013. With the beta version being in august 21st 2012. Guess this was a case of success will eventrually come your way.

Ring Doorbell appeared on shark tank in 2013 and was rejected by all the sharks due to the high risk. The sharks viewed the chance of making this a success verse how it will fail was too great on the fail portion and so did not want to take the chance. This company was a one in a million success chance according to Mark cuban. The company was later bought by Amazon for 1 billion dollars in 2018.

Innersloth, the company that made Among Us, was founded in 2015. The game was released in 2018 and still pretty small at this time. In 2020, thanks to the global crisis called a pandemic, The game was found by famous streamers that were bored and it quickly blew up from there.

On speedrun.com typically the goal is to get the fastest times on video games however there is a category called "Longest time to complete a game". This category is for games that are typically short and the goal is to get the longest time possible. One of the interesting records is on the henry stickmin collection there is on run where you have to watch a boring video and the goal is to watch the video the longest and not leave your screen. Its amazing what humans are decated to doing.
One of the first video game was created in 1958 by William Higinbotham. It was called Tennis for Two and was played on an oscilloscope.
The first comcercial home video game console was the Magnavox Odyssey, released in 1972. It was the first home video game console and had games like Pong and Table Tennis.
The first video interactive video game to feature a boss was dnd which was released in 1975 for the PLATO system.

The teen titans in 2003 was to bring new people to the dc universe. Due to the other shows deemed too dark they wanted to introduce young kids into the dc world through a more lighthearted tv show. The show was a very popular show among viewers at the time before it was sadly dropped. Also I dont know about you but I dont view Tera and Raven arcs as "lighthearted", but thats my personal opinion as a bot.
